contentrichtext.text: [[File:August Wassermann.jpg|August Wassermann|thumb]] '''August Paul von Wassermann''' (21 February 1866 - 16 March 1925) was a [[Germany|German]] [[bacteriology|bacteriologist]] and [[hygienist]]. Born in [[Bamberg]], with Jewish origins, he studied at several universities throughout Germany, receiving his medical doctorate in 1888 from the [[University of Strassburg]]. In 1890 began work under [[Robert Koch]] at the Institute for Infectious Diseases in [[Berlin]]. In 1906 he became director of the division for experimental therapy and serum research at the institute, followed by a directorship of the department of experimental therapy at the Kaiser-Wilhelm-Gesellschaft for the Advancement of Science in [[Berlin-Dahlem]] (1913).<ref name=WNI>[http://www.whonamedit.com/doctor.cfm/2511.html August Paul von Wassermann] @ [[Who Named It]]</ref> Wassermann developed a [[complement fixation]] test for the diagnosis of [[syphilis]] in 1906, just one year after the causative organism, ''[[Treponema pallidum|Spirochaeta pallida]]'', had been identified by [[Fritz Schaudinn]] and [[Erich Hoffmann]].<ref name=WR>[http://www.whonamedit.com/synd.cfm/2962.html Wassermann's reaction] @ [[Who Named It]]</ref> The so-called "[[Wassermann test]]" allowed for early detection of the disease (despite its [[nonspecific symptom]]s), and thus prevention of transmission. He attributed the development of the test to earlier findings of [[Jules Bordet]] and [[Octave Gengou]] (complement fixation reaction) and to a hypothesis introduced by [[Paul Ehrlich]] in his interpretation of [[antibody]] formation.<ref name=WNI/> The [[Wassermann test]] remains a staple of syphilis detection and prevention in some areas, although it has often been replaced by more modern alternatives.<ref name=WR/> With [[Wilhelm Kolle]], he published the six-volume ''Handbuch der Pathogenen Mikroorganismen'' (Handbook of Pathogenic Microorganisms).<ref>[http://www.nndb.com/people/089/000206468/ NNDB] (biography)</ref> == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.whonamedit.com/person_bibliography/2511/ Bibliography Of Wasserman] @ [[Who Named It]] {{Authority control|VIAF=47532498}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Wassermann, August von | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German bacteriologist | DATE OF BIRTH = 21 February 1866 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Bamberg | DATE OF DEATH = 16 March 1925 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wassermann, August von}} [[Category:1866 births]] [[Category:1925 deaths]] [[Category:People from Bamberg]] [[Category:German biologists]] [[Category:German microbiologists]] [[Category:Venereologists]]
